title: section 24 of the Interpretation Act 2005, and of all other powers enabling them
heading: 1. (1) These Rules, which shall come into operation on the 10th day of
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules, which shall come into operation on the 10th day of 

November 2020, may be cited as the District Court (Order 36) Rules 2020. 

(2) These Rules shall be construed together with the District Court Rules 

1997 (S.I. No. 93 of 1997) and all other District Court Rules. 

(3) The District Court Rules as amended by these Rules may be cited as the 

District Court Rules 1997 to 2020.

title: section 24 of the Interpretation Act 2005, and of all other powers enabling them
heading: 2. The District Court Rules 1997 (S.I. No. 93 of 1997) are amended:
text_raw:
2. The District Court Rules 1997 (S.I. No. 93 of 1997) are amended: 

(i) 

by the substitution for rule 1 of Order 36 of the following 
rule: 

“1. Where the Court makes an order in any case of 
summary jurisdiction (including an order to "strike out" for 
want of jurisdiction) it may make an order in accordance 
with law ordering any party to the proceedings to pay to the 
other party such costs and witnesses' expenses as it shall 
think fit to award.” 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 6th November, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [496]

title: section 24 of the Interpretation Act 2005, and of all other powers enabling them
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These rules amend Order 36 rule 1 arising from the judgment in DPP v McGrath 
[2019] IECA 320.
